alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 09 at 5:03PM MST until March 11 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM FRIDAY TO 4 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations 1 to 4 inches in the valleys below 3000 feet. Total snow accumulation between 8 and 12 inches for the mountains above 3000 feet. * WHERE...Lookout Pass, St. Maries, Wallace, Fourth Of July Pass, Kellogg, Osburn, Fernwood, Dobson Pass, Pinehurst, and Mullan. * WHEN...From 4 AM Friday to 4 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Motorists should be prepared for winter driving conditions in the lowlands Friday morning before conditions improve as temperatures climb into the mid to upper 30s during the afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel over Lookout Pass on Interstate 90 may become challenging Friday morning during the first wave of heavy snow, and again Friday evening as temperatures drop below freezing.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
